text: - By mid-2022, MuleSoft was still growing,

but at a slower rate, so the
challenge for the company
is to reduce costs.

The senior teams want to focus
on delivering customer value.

They want to go back to
the previous golden age
where they can just focusing on the growth
instead of focusing on cost savings.
We need a system in order to support that.
We have consulted with AWS account teams
about the AWS tools that we could use.
We were able to build a data warehouse

and a visibility portal to
let the engineering team know
what exactly they need to do to improve
on the Well-Architected pillars.

We started from the cost
of reduction projects,
which is one of the pillars
of the Well-Architected Framework,
and we found out there are opportunities
in other pillars as well,

including efficiency,
security, and sustainability.
With this framework, we were able

to connect the company's
goals and the KPIs

to how the engineering
teams can help the company

to achieve its goals in
terms of the cloud maturity.

So I think AWS has been a
really great partner, right?
So they really listen to the customer,

and they try to provide
all the service tools
and any opportunity that they can provide
to support the customer to succeed.
(bright music)
